item.title: Waiting for the Editor: A New App
item.description:
If waiting to hear back from journals makes you as twitchy as it makes me, you might appreciate Waiting for the Editor. It’s a little app that displays wait time forecasts and data from the APA Journal Survey.

It has two kinds of display, similar to my earlier post on the APA survey. You can view scatterplots like this one:

Or ridgeplots like this one:

NB: the ridgeplots include old data as well as new, so they can be misleading. If a journal’s wait times have improved/worsened since the survey started in 2009, this won’t be reflected in the ridgeplot.

You can customize these displays by…

  1. choosing which journals to show.
  2. including all submissions or just e.g. rejected ones, since accepted submissions are overrepresented.
  3. choosing what dates you want to draw the data from, since some journals have gotten better/worse since the survey started in 2009.
  4. choosing your own cap for the maximum review time to display.
